reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Biogas system to produce gas from fruits + vegetable market waste to supply cooking fuel + lights to local families and venders

description.narrative: Project aims to find environmentally-benign solutions by establishing BG demo system using locally available materials + skills to produce clean fuel for transport cooking + lighting using biomass waste from vegetable market + also controlling pollution (a ir + land) + imparting training.There are several Wholesale Fruit + Vegetable Market (WSF+VM) in Delhi and they all come under the APMC. Azadpur is Asia's largest WSFVM in 90 acres Other 2 big WSFVM are in Okhla + Gazipur. All 3 WSFVMs generates huge quant ity organic waste that is land-filled + produce large amount of uncontrolled methane which often create fire especially during summer. INSEDA's grassroots NGO partner WAFD has been working in Delhi slums since 1978, to train them for selling organic produc e of women from its 6 EVD villages in New Tehri + 4 EVD villages in Alwar. The main local partner INSEDA is responsible for providing technical expertise + project coordination. Main technical challenge is to design install + demonstrate a high-rate bi-pha sic (a combination of aerobic + anaerobic digester) BG system for processing of 1000 Kg (5-8%) of organic waste generated each day from Azadpur (or Okhla/Gazipur) WSFVM or from WSFVM located in Delhi NCR to produce biogas for use as clean fuel. INSEDA's te chnical team headed by its Chief Executive with over 36-years experience in all aspects of BGPs jointly with Finnish BG company Metener which will design unit for purification and compression of produced BG. The project is based on the learning and feedbac k from the on-going 250-k/d pilot demo-cum-training bi-phasic BG unit.Produced biogas is meant to be utilized to converted 3-wheel autos and to local women + vegetable/fruit vendors for cooking + lighting. Dried BG digested slurry is sold as enriched bio-m anure.The purpose of the project is to demonstrate to decision makers how the wholesale market organic waste can be utilized for the benefit of local people and at the same time effectively reduce greenhouse gas emissions and other negative environmental i mpacts. The aim is also to create markets for Finnish renewable energy technology innovations.
